I've updated the bugzilla validation slightly and if validation is successful the message area is updated to this effect, but if an error occurs, the MylarStatus is still displayed.

This comes back to the issue of standardized error reporting. Ideally I'd like this to be handled by MylarStatus as well (the dialog error message should be based on MylarMessages I think).  So there will be some work yet to do since the messages for dialogs are usually too verbose for the error message area in a wizard page.

In this case I would suggest to replace validate method with getValidator and MylarStatus into a contract for such validator... Then all the logic for running it in the background can be moved into the super class.

I want to keep showing the dialog for Trac since I may need to display a warning message in case privileges are not sufficient for XML-RPC access (bug 169729) and I need the wizard message area for that. Another reason why I don't like it much is that the message remains to be displayed even when the repository information is edited after validation although the credentials may not be valid anymore. 

Eugene, if you want to keep it the way it is now, please add an icon next to the message (setMessage(..., IMessageProvider.INFORMATION)) to make it stick out.

Good point Steffen. I committed icon and added some cleanup.

As for resetting the error and info messages, it would make more sense to do it in super class to simplify connector-specific code...
I like how the validation info and error icons now show up for JIRA.  How hard is it to get this working for all connectors?
